H0.text: The gravesite of what American writer, buried in Baltimore, is mysteriously visited every January 19th, to receive a toast of cognac and 3 roses. Herman Melville

H1.text: The gravesite of what American writer, buried in Baltimore, is mysteriously visited every January 19th, to receive a toast of cognac and 3 roses. F. Scott Fitzgerald

H2.text: The gravesite of what American writer, buried in Baltimore, is mysteriously visited every January 19th, to receive a toast of cognac and 3 roses. Edgar Lee Masters

H3.text: The gravesite of what American writer, buried in Baltimore, is mysteriously visited every January 19th, to receive a toast of cognac and 3 roses. Poe

A4.text: Between 1949 and 2009, a bottle of cognac and three roses were left at Poe's original grave marker every January 19 by an unknown visitor.

A5.text: Sam Porpora was a historian at the Westminster Church in Baltimore, where Poe is buried;
